description: From Middle English gentryse, from Old French genterise, variant form of gentelise, from gentil.

entries.meaning: (archaic) The state or quality of being high-born; gentility.

examples: Where she came from no man could tell. There were some said she was no woman, but a ghost haunting some mortal tenement. Others would threep she was gentrice, come of a persecuting family in the west, who had been ruined in the Revolution wars.
